PAGE_DESCRIPTION: Jorge Macias - Software Developer in Backend, Frontend, and Desktop Applications.
ABOUT_ME: I am a software developer with experience in web development: backend and frontend. I also have experience in developing Windows desktop applications.
I have worked with a variety of programming languages and frameworks, which has allowed me to adapt easily to development environments and collaborate effectively in teams.
HERO_TAGLINE: Software developer with solid practical experience in different languages and environments, able to adapt quickly to new challenges thanks to the knowledge acquired in various projects.

content.name: JavaScript
content.description: I learned this language to begin my journey as a web developer.

content.name: TypeScript
content.description: After learning JavaScript, I moved to TypeScript to take advantage of the type system and avoid problems associated with JavaScript.

content.name: C#
content.description: I learned it in university and have developed some applications that automate internal processes at my university.

content.description: I've used Python for competitive programming in the ICPC Mexico. I've also used it in projects like a 3D demo using OpenGL and for working with sockets.

content.description: I learned Lua while helping a friend improve a mod for The Binding of Isaac, taking advantage of its simplicity for scripting.

EXPERIENCES.description: As a frontend developer, my responsibilities included consuming REST APIs, attending daily meetings, maintaining a landing page, and collaborating with UX/UI designers.

As a Backend Developer and DevOps, some of my responsibilities included: implementing software architecture for creating a REST API for a product that would increase the client's control over their operations. Improving a previous project with new technologies. Using OpenAPI to create nearly automatic documentation. Additionally, setting up continuous deployment systems for the backend and frontend required for the product.

PROJECTS.title: Minecraft-Map-To-Image
PROJECTS.description: Desktop application that allows saving Minecraft in-game maps as images.
responsabilities: Design and implementation of the user interface using WPF.
Development of application functionalities in C#.

roles: Improving ease of adding new features

Implement changes to facilitate the addition of new features by the original creator.

PROJECTS.title: Monte-Carlo-Global-Illumination-Demo
PROJECTS.description: A 3D program that uses OpenGL and Pygame, along with the Monte Carlo method, to simulate global illumination in an environment.

PROJECTS.title: Socket-practice
PROJECTS.description: Implementation of TCP and UDP server/client, using it for use cases such as: messaging application and file transfer.
responsabilities: Implement the use of TCP sockets in something useful, a messaging server and client.
Implement the use of UDP sockets in something useful, file transfer.
